page.title: 06BROXBOURNE STATION
page.content: Broxbourne Station is our local railway station. It is on one of the main lines into London. Local trains travel between Bishop's Stortford and Hertford East. Express trains travel between London, Cambridge and Kings Lynne. The new station was opened in 1960. The old station is about 100 metres away. 20 people work there; three signalmen, five junior railmen, two shunters, three senior railmen, one station manager and two others. The busiest times of the day are between 7am and 9am, 4.45pm and 6.30pm. 180 trains call at the station daily. Trains are usually on time or are delayed for a simple reason. There are 10 level crossings on this line. The station is open all year except for Christmas day and Boxing day.
